alert.note: Alert for Sarasota (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 15 at 10:19PM EDT until October 17 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17 affecting Hardee County. Peace River At Bartow affecting Polk County. .River flooding continues along some local rivers. Flood waters are forecast to continue to recede. For the Myakka...including Myakka River State Park...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Myakka River At Myakka River State Park. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Trails, picnic areas, and parking lots at Myakka State Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM EDT Saturday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 12/28/2002. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Myakka River Myakka River Stat 7.0 7.2 Sat 10 pm 7.0 6.9 6.7 6.5 6.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 130 PM EDT.
